page.title: 17Gawcott <2>
page.content: At the east end of the Church is a large screen. The first vicar was the Reverend {Thomas Scott }, father of architect, Gilbert Scott. The{cemetry is opposite the Church. There are both old and new houses in Church Street including the Old School House which is now a private dwelling and a laundry. The{village hall}was built in{1924. Gawcott has two small {factories}and a petrol station. The public house in Hillesden Road is called the Crown Inn. The village store cum post office is in Main Street. The surrounding area is agricultural - mainly{arable}growing wheat, barley and oil seed rape and grassland.
